content.description: Sit start with hands matched on a jug sidepull. From there, cross over with a left hand pinch-pocket, bump through a right hand gaston to an uneven edge, reach a left hand edge, hit the lip, and mantle on top.
content.protection: A pad will work fine. The landing is great, but there is a cactus patch behind the problem.
content.location: It climbs the center section of Junior Mint's north face.

content.description: Sit start with a left hand shallow pocket and a right hand sidepull. From there, pull up using the good right hand feature, bump the left up to an edge, match on it, reach the lip, and mantle atop.
content.protection: A pair of pads or pad will work fine. The landing has a rock next to it, but it doesn't play a factor.
content.location: It climbs the east section of Junior Mint's north face.

content.description: Sit start with hands matched on an edge. From there, pull to a left hand gaston, then a right hand edge. Set the feet, and hit a left hand mail slot. Then work the remaining edges to reach an easy mantle.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing has a rock in the middle of it. Other than that, the landing is pretty good.
content.location: It climbs the east section of Junior Mint's south face.

content.description: Stand start with hands matched on the jug rail of the boulder's divide. From there, climb straight up on good edges to reach an easy mantle.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work well. The landing is good, but there is a rock that makes for a slightly uneven situation.
content.location: It climbs the south section of Junior Mint's west face.
